title: Foundation in Design Principles
description: Develop a strong understanding of fundamental design principles such as color theory, typography, layout, and visual hierarchy. No specific A/L stream is required, but a background in Art or IT is helpful. Start building a portfolio with personal projects.

title: Mastering UI/UX Tools & Education
description: Gain proficiency in industry-standard design and prototyping tools. Consider a formal diploma or degree to learn the structured process of user-centered design, from research to final mockups.
institutes: Online bootcamps (e.g., Google UX Design Certificate)

title: Junior UI/UX Designer Role
description: Join a tech company or a design agency as a Junior UI/UX Designer. You will work on specific features of a product, creating wireframes, mockups, and prototypes under the guidance of senior designers. Your primary focus will be on execution and learning the product development lifecycle.
qualifications: A strong portfolio showcasing case studies

title: Mid-Level Product Designer
description: Transition into a Product Designer role, where you take more ownership of the design process. You'll be responsible for conducting user research, defining problems, and designing end-to-end solutions for larger features or entire products.
qualifications: Proven track record of shipping successful products
institutes: All major product-based tech companies in Sri Lanka

title: Senior/Lead Product Designer or UX Researcher
description: Advance to a leadership role where you guide the design vision for a product area, manage other designers, and align design strategy with business goals. Alternatively, you can specialize in a niche area like UX Research or Interaction Design.
